results.name: Triangle read by rows: absolute values of odd-numbered rows of A225356.
comment: An equivalent definition: take the polynomials corresponding to rows 2, 4, 6, 8, ... of A060187, divide by x+1, and extract the coefficients. [Corrected by _Petros Hadjicostas_, Apr 17 2020]
For n >= 1, row n has length 2*n-1.
formula: Triangle read by rows: row n gives coefficients in the expansion of the polynomial ((x - 1)^(2*n)/(x + 1)) * Sum_{k >= 0} (2*k + 1)^(2*n-1)*x^k. The infinite sum simplifies to a polynomial.
T(n,m) = Sum_{k=0..m} A060187(2*n,k+1)*(-1)^(m-k) for n >= 1 and 0 <= m <= 2*n-2. - _Petros Hadjicostas_, Apr 17 2020
example: Triangle T(n,m) (for n >= 1 and 0 <= m <= 2*n - 2) begins as follows:
mathematica: (* Power series via an infinite sum *)
p[t_] = Exp[t]*x/(-Exp[2*t] + x);Flatten[ Table[ CoefficientList[FullSimplify[ExpandAll[(n!*(-1 + x)^(n + 1)/(x*(x + 1)))*SeriesCoefficient[ Series[p[t], {t, 0, 30}], n]]], x], {n, 1, 13, 2}]]
